p: Next, we tested the effect of the UBKIs on the non-related viruses cowpox virus (CPXV), herpes simplex virus 1 (HSV1), hantavirus (HTV), and vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV) ( Fig 6B). We observed strong effects on HTV, and VSV but only mild effects on CPXV and HSV1. This difference is likely due to the different mechanisms of entry between the viruses: HTV and VSV enter host cells exclusively via the endocytic route [ 32– 34], whereas CPXV and HSV1 can enter by direct fusion with the cellular plasma membrane, as well as via the endocytic route [ 35, 36]. Of note, we applied both inhibitors at 3 μM, as this dose was neither cytotoxic in A549 cells ( Fig 3A and 3B), used with CPXV, HSV1, and VSV, nor in HEL-derived megakaryocytes ( S9A Fig), used with HTV. In conclusion, regorafenib and sorafenib display antiviral activity against all viruses tested, particularly those that rely exclusively on the endocytic route.
